channel.title: Unattackable?
channel.description: i want to make a certain npc id unattackable, i used it to make a wall so people wont wonder into the wild, any idea on how to disable attacking this npc?

item.title: Unattackable?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Give it HP, and make count the brackets around the snippet I gave you, there should be equal amounts of both opening and closing brackets.
Here’s what I have, the snippet I gave you is highlighted, and all the brackets are paired and color coded.

// Attacking an NPC if ((IsAttackingNPC == true) && (deathStage == 0) && System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction > actionInterval) [size=14pt][b]{[/b][/size] if (Server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc] != null) [size=14pt][b]{[/b][/size] [shadow=red,left]if (Server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].npcType == 1) [size=14pt][b]{[/b][/size] ResetAttackNPC(); return false; [size=14pt][b]}[/b][/size][/shadow] if ((Server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].IsDead == false) && (Server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].MaxHP > 0)) [size=14pt][b]{[/b][/size] AttackNPC(); [size=14pt][b]}[/b][/size] else [size=14pt][b]{[/b][/size] // ResetAttackNPC(); [size=14pt][b]}[/b][/size] [size=14pt][b]}[/b][/size] else [size=14pt][b]{[/b][/size] ResetAttackNPC(); [size=14pt][b]}[/b][/size] [size=14pt][b]}[/b][/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Unattackable?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“Christiaan, post:16, topic:358810”]if it isnt a custom npc you might add this:
if(i == NPC ID) {
aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630];
class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60);
class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
class5.aStringArray66[1] = “Attack”;
}

im not sure if this works…[/quote]
That would add the attack string.

Mine works, I tested it myself, you just need to change Server to server.

item.title: Unattackable?
item.dc:creator: @Christiaan Christiaan
item.description:
@Christiaan wrote:

When you attack an NPC, you right click on it and click on attack.
This “attack button” comes with what i just said,
I thought: if we just delete that button, no one can attack those NPC’s?

item.title: Unattackable?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:8, topic:358810”]Look for

// Attacking an NPC

And add

if (Server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].npcType == NPCID) { ResetAttackNPC(); return false; }
After

if (Server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc] != null) {

when i add the first code, i get this error when i compile:

.\client.java:24299: package server does not exist
If (server.npcHandler.nps(attacknpc.].npcType == 237) {

@christan, i dont think the client has anything to do with this :o, but thanks for trying though

item.title: Unattackable?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You can find where attacking them is handled and add a condition that will exclude the npc from being attacked

if (Server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].npcType == NPCID) { ResetAttackNPC(); return; }

Read full topic

item.title: Unattackable?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

they still walk up to it to attack, and the npc walks to the player, and the thing is most of the time, you disconect when you attack it, thats why i want to make it unatackable

you cant attack them, but when you click on them to attack, they come and attack you, i want to make it so they cant fightback either
